DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study characterize long-term safety oxycodone hydrochloride ( HCl ) controlled-release ( CR ) tablets opioid experienced pediatric patient age 6 17 year , inclusive , moderate severe malignant and/or nonmalignant pain require opioid therapy complete 4 -week treatment period OTR3001 .
DOC.brief_title: Long-Term Safety Twice Daily Oxycodone Hydrochloride Controlled-release Tablets Children Who Completed OTR3001
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria include : 1 . Male female patient age 6 17 year , inclusive , complete 4week study drug treatment study OTR3001 , base investigator 's judgment , benefit continue treatment oxycodone HCl CR 20 240 mg/day management moderate severe malignant nonmalignant pain ; 2 . Patients must tolerate oxycodone HCl CR therapy OTR3001 demonstrate start study ; 3 . Patients must willing able swallow oxycodone HCl CR tablet whole . Exclusion Criteria include : 1 . Patients ongoing adverse event OTR3001 , investigator 's opinion , disqualify participation study ; 2 . Female patient pregnant lactating ; 3 . Patients require opioid dos equivalent < 20 mg/day > 240 mg/day oxycodone treatment malignant nonmalignant pain ; 4 . Patients allergic oxycodone history allergy opioids ( criterion include patient experienced common opioid side effect [ eg , nausea , constipation ] ) ; 5 . Patients contraindicate use opioids ; 6 . Patients currently maintain methadone pain ; 7 . Patients abnormality vital sign , physical examination , laboratory test significant enough investigator deem patient appropriate study ; 8 . Patients plan surgery course study , exception placement central peripheral venous access device ; 9 . Patients currently take investigational medication/therapy study drug ( oxycodone HCl CR ) start screen study . Other protocol specific inclusion/exclusion criterion may apply .
